programme.title: Ghost in the Shell
programme.sub-title: Action, Drama, Sci Fi, Crime/detective, Mystery, Thriller ║ 2017 ║ 12
programme.desc: Sci-fi action thriller based on the popular ital}anime and manga series, starring Scarlett Johansson. Following a terrible accident, the brain of Major Mira Killian is transplanted into a robotic body and she is transformed into a super-soldier tasked with fighting terrorism. But as memories of Major's past life begin to emerge, she suspects that not all is as it seems Rupert Sanders - Director Scarlett Johansson - Major Pilou Asbaek - Batou Takeshi Kitano - Daisuke Aramaki Juliette Binoche - Dr Ouelet Michael Pitt - Kuze Anamaria Marinca - Dr Dahlin Peter Ferdinando - Cutter Chin Han - Togusa Danusia Samal - Ladriya Michael Wincott - Dr Osmond Rila Fukushima - Red robed geisha Scarlett Johansson - Major Pilou Asbaek - Batou Takeshi Kitano - Daisuke Aramaki Juliette Binoche - Dr Ouelet Michael Pitt - Kuze Anamaria Marinca - Dr Dahlin Peter Ferdinando - Cutter Chin Han - Togusa Danusia Samal - Ladriya Michael Wincott - Dr Osmond Rila Fukushima - Red robed geisha.

programme.title: Wimbledon
programme.desc: Romantic sports comedy starring Kirsten Dunst and Paul Bettany. Fading British tennis star Peter Colt prepares philosophically for his last All England Championships. programme.title: Forrest Gump
programme.desc: Oscar-winning comedy drama starring Tom Hanks, Gary Sinise and Robin Wright. Forrest Gump wasn't born with a lot of smarts, but he is encouraged by his mother to realise his full potential. He attends college on a sports scholarship, meeting President Kennedy in the process, joins the army and is sent to Vietnam. programme.title: Anyone But You
programme.desc: Bea and Ben enjoy an incredible first date, but attraction quickly burns out and they are delighted to be apart. However, fate compels the duo to reconsider, and they seize the opportunity to attend a lavish wedding in Australia, as a couple. The pair pretend to be deliriously in love during the once-in-a-lifetime trip and keep up appearances in front of other guests. programme.title: Chicago

programme.desc: Oscar-winning musical starring Catherine Zeta-Jones, Renée Zellweger and Richard Gere. programme.title: The Cinema List: Revenge
programme.desc: Some films are best served cold, so wrap up and join us as we dive into our favourite revenge movies - from new hits to Oscar-winning classics. We hope you're ready for action.

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biographical drama starring Eddie Redmayne and Alicia Vikander. Copenhagen in the 1920s: Einar and Gerda Wegener are artists who enjoy a happy married and professional life. programme.title: Erin Brockovich
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biographical drama starring Julia Roberts. programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: Oscar-winning historical drama starring Colin Firth, Helena Bonham Carter and Geoffrey Rush. programme.title: The Taming of the Shrew
programme.desc: Shakespeare's battle-of-the-sexes comedy starring Richard Burton and Elizabeth Taylor. programme.title: Moving On
programme.desc: Comedy drama starring Jane Fonda and Lily Tomlin. programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Anthony Hopkins, Helena Bonham Carter and Johnny Flynn. In 1938, young British stockbroker Nicholas Winton visits Prague and becomes involved in an audacious plan to evacuate hundreds of Jewish children before the Nazis close the borders. programme.title: The End Of The Affair (1955)
programme.desc: In World War II London, a writer falls in love with the wife of a British civil servant - but both men suspect her of infidelity with yet another man. Romantic drama. (1955)(102 mins).

programme.title: Young At Heart
programme.desc: Self-destructive musician Frank Sinatra manages to woo sunny, positive, Doris Day in this charming romantic musical. Gig Young and Ethel Barrymore co-star. (1954)(113mins).

programme.title: The Dam Busters
programme.desc: Classic WWII epic about an engineer's daring plan to use bouncing bombs and low-flying aircraft to destroy a series of German dams. Richard Todd and Michael Redgrave star. (1955)(124 mins).

programme.title: Paper Moon
programme.desc: When conman Ryan O'Neal is lumbered with an orphaned girl, she soon decides to join the swindle. 10-year-old Tatum O'Neal stars in an Oscar-winning role. (1973)(102mins).

programme.title: Fanny And Alexander
programme.desc: Two young Swedish children in the 1900s experience the many comedies and tragedies of their lively and affectionate theatrical family, the Ekdahls. (1982)(188 mins).

programme.title: Cries And Whispers
programme.desc: When Maria and Karin visit their terminally ill sister Agnes to take care of her, feelings of resentment start to resurface. (1972)(95 mins).

programme.title: Lady Bird
programme.desc: Greta Gerwig's Golden Globe winner stars Saoirse Ronan as a teen desperate to move on and start a new life elsewhere. Strong language/sex/flashing images. (2017)(91 mins).

programme.title: Lost In Translation
programme.desc: Bored in a Tokyo hotel, Bill Murray and Scarlett Johansson share an unlikely brief encounter. Oscar-winning romance. Contains sexual scenes. (2003)(98 mins).

programme.title: Escape From Alcatraz
programme.desc: Fact-based adventure following a group of convicts as they attempt to break out of the world's most notorious prison. Starring Clint Eastwood. Violence/flashing images. (1979)(107 mins).

programme.title: Dunkirk (2017)
programme.desc: Trapped and depleted, the British Army attempt to carry out a desperate evacuation of northern France. Gripping WWII epic from Christopher Nolan, starring Tom Hardy. (2017)(102 mins).

programme.title: The Day Of The Jackal
programme.desc: When meticulous hitman Edward Fox is hired to kill the French president, detective Michael Lonsdale faces a race against time to track him down. Violent scenes. (1972)(137 mins).

programme.title: Sleepers
programme.desc: Brad Pitt stars in the true story of the men who took revenge on the prison guards who abused them as kids. Intense drama. Strong language/violence/sex/mature themes. (1996)(147 mins).

programme.title: The Exorcist
programme.desc: William Friedkin's Oscar-winning horror about a priest battling to save the soul of a girl. Language/violence/mature themes/sex/flashing images. (1973)(116 mins).

programme.title: Fanny And Alexander
programme.desc: Two young Swedish children in the 1900s experience the many comedies and tragedies of their lively and affectionate theatrical family, the Ekdahls. (1982)(188 mins).

programme.title: Champion

programme.desc: Pakistan and Sri Lanka go toe to toe in Group A on opening day of the 2024 ICC Women's T20 World Cup in Sharjah. The top two teams from each group will advance to the semi-finals. (03.10).

programme.title: ICC Women's WC: WI v AUS 2013
programme.desc: At the 2013 ICC Women's Cricket World Cup in India, the West Indies went toe to toe with Australia in the final. A sixth World Cup title was up for grabs for the Aussies.

programme.title: ICC Women's WC: ENG v AUS 2017
programme.desc: At the 2017 ICC Women's Cricket World Cup in England, the hosts would meet Australia in the fifth round of group stage matches.

programme.title: ICC Women's WC: ENG v SA 2017
programme.desc: At the 2017 ICC Women's Cricket World Cup in England, the hosts met South Africa in the semi-final.

programme.title: ICC Women's WC: ENG v IND 2017
programme.desc: Revisit the final of the 2017 ICC Women's Cricket World Cup, as England - hosts of the tournament - clashed with 2005 runners-up India at Lord's. England were targeting title number four.

programme.title: LIVE: Ladies European Tour Golf
programme.desc: Round four of the 2024 Aramco Team Series comes from Mission Hills Resort in Shenzhen, as day one of the team event gets underway. (04.10).
